title: U.S. begins to withdraw troops from northern Syria after Trump's Turkey call
text:
The U.S. began pulling out its troops from northern Syria near the Turkish border on Monday, reports the Washington Post.

Why it matters: The U.S. had been trying for months to broker a truce between two allies, Turkey and the Kurdish fighters in the region, after the defeat of ISIS, but this decision effectively removes the U.S. from the equation. It comes just hours after the White House issued a statement late Sunday night that the U.S. would not interfere in a "long-planned" Turkish military operation in the region after a call between President Trump and Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan.
description: It effectively ends hopes for a U.S.-brokered peace between Turkey and Kurdish fighters.
